com.github.dm.jrt.stream.builder

Interface StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>

  • Type Parameters:
    IN - the input data type.
    OUT - the output data type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    InvocationConfigurable<RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT>>, InvocationConfiguration.Configurable<RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT>>, Routine<IN,OUT>, RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStreamBuilder

    public interface StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>
extends RoutineBuilder<IN,OUT>
    Interface defining a builder of routines backing a concatenation of mapping routines and consumers.
    Each routine in the stream may have its own specific configuration and invocation mode.

    Note that, based on the routines which are part of the chain, the results might be propagated only when the built routine invocation completes.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 07/01/2016.

      Interface defining a stream configuration.

      • applyStreamInvocationConfiguration

        @NotNull
InvocationConfiguration.Builder<? extends StreamBuilder<IN,OUT>> applyStreamInvocationConfiguration()
        Gets the invocation configuration builder related to the whole stream.
        The configuration options will be applied to all the next concatenated routine unless overwritten by specific ones.

        Note that the configuration builder will be initialized with the current stream configuration.

        Returns:
        the invocation configuration builder.

        Note, however, that the runner will still be overridden by the configured current one.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • immediate

        @NotNull
StreamBuilder<IN,OUT> immediate()
        Modifies the stream configuration, so that the concatenated routines will be invoked in asynchronous mode employing the shared immediate runner.
        Note, however, that the runner will still be overridden by the configured current one.

        Unlike the default synchronous runner, the employed one makes so that each routine in the chain is passed any input as soon as it is produced by the previous one. Such behavior decreases memory demands at the expense of a deeper stack of calls. In fact, the default synchronous runner breaks up routine calls so to perform them in a loop. The main drawback of the latter approach is that all input data might be accumulated before actually being processed by the next routine invocation.

        Returns:
        this builder.
        See Also:
        Runners.immediateRunner()

      • immediateParallel

        @NotNull
StreamBuilder<IN,OUT> immediateParallel()
        Modifies the stream configuration, so that the concatenated routines will be invoked in parallel mode employing the shared immediate runner.
        Note, however, that the runner will still be overridden by the configured current one.

        Unlike the default synchronous runner, the employed one makes so that each routine in the chain is passed any input as soon as it is produced by the previous one. Such behavior decreases memory demands at the expense of a deeper stack of calls. In fact, the default synchronous runner breaks up routine calls so to perform them in a loop. The main drawback of the latter approach is that all input data might be accumulated before actually being processed by the next routine invocation.

        Returns:
        this builder.
        See Also:
        Runners.immediateRunner()

        Transforms this stream by applying the specified function.

        This method provides a convenient way to apply a set of configurations and concatenations without breaking the fluent chain.

        Type Parameters:

        AFTER - the concatenation output type.

        Throws:

<AFTER> StreamBuilder<IN,AFTER> mapAccept(@NotNull
                                                   BiConsumer<? super OUT,? super Channel<AFTER,?>> mappingConsumer)
        Concatenates a routine mapping this stream outputs through the specified consumer.
        The result channel of the backing routine will be passed to the consumer, so that multiple or no results may be generated.

        Note that the created routine will be initialized with the current configuration.

      • mapOn

        @NotNull
StreamBuilder<IN,OUT> mapOn(@Nullable
                                     Runner runner)
        Short for async().applyStreamInvocationConfiguration().withRunner(runner).configured() .map(IdentityInvocation.&lt;OUT&gt;factoryOf()).
        This method is useful to easily make the stream run on the specified runner.

        Note that it is not necessary to explicitly concatenate a routine to have a stream delivering the output data through the specified runner.

        Parameters:
        runner - the runner instance.
        Returns:
        this builder.

StreamBuilder<IN,OUT> sorted()
        Makes the outputs of this stream sorted by the order they are passed to the result channel.
        Note, however, that the modified options will still be overridden by the configured current ones.
